Eleven tracks of non-stop gritty, groovy and down right dirty party rock make up THCÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s latest endeavor. From the opening Ã¢â‚¬ËœGet Your Hands UpÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ to the closer Ã¢â‚¬ËœThink of Me,Ã¢â‚¬â„¢ this record is the bandÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s grand opus to party rock.

Sounding like the bastard that spawned from a threesome between Monster Magnet, Willie Nelson and Pantera, THC has already carved out a spot for themselves in the world of metal with their brand of red dirt rock.

What Ã¢â‚¬ËœPeacemakerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ does, though, is takes that brand and elevates it to a more significant level. The band sounds tighter than ever, the guitar riffs are incredibly crushing to say the least and the lyrics are exactly what youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve come to love and adore about this band.

The track that sums up the album has to be Ã¢â‚¬ËœDamn You To Hell.Ã¢â‚¬â„¢ From the opening guitar riff to the unforgettable chorus, this song takes no prisoners. With lyrics like Ã¢â‚¬Å“I have a big olÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ truck / And I canÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t get stuck / You think I suck / And I donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t give a fÃ¢â‚¬â€Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ and Ã¢â‚¬Å“IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m a lunatic and IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m about to be sick / IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m a maniac and IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m about to attackÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ makes this tune shine. Consider this the anthem for THC.

Another killer track on Ã¢â‚¬ËœPeacemaker is the first single Ã¢â‚¬ËœTurn It Up.Ã¢â‚¬â„¢ Lead singer Big Dad Ritch takes fans on a trip down strip club lane with lyrics like, Ã¢â‚¬Å“Little Sarah was from Texas / She was the preacherÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s daughter / She never practiced much of what her father taught her.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ If you like the lyrics, youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll love the music video Ã¢â‚¬â€œ trust us.

So is Ã¢â‚¬ËœPeacemakerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ the album that is going to blow up the genre? No. THC have their own way of doing things, and thatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s what sets them apart from others in the metal scene. You can hear the red dirt and Southern influence in their music, creating a memorable experience for anyone who hears Ã¢â‚¬ËœPeacemaker.Ã¢â‚¬â„¢

This isnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t merely a party album (although we must admit, it is the perfect record to play beginning to end the next time you throw a little barbecue). Blast after blast of their signature rock Ã¢â‚¬ËœnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ roll, THC sets the stage with Ã¢â‚¬ËœPeacemakerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ for what just might be one helluva breakout year for the band.

In Ã¢â‚¬ËœDamn You To Hell,Ã¢â‚¬â„¢ Big Dad Ritch says, Ã¢â‚¬Å“If you want something, come on / Yeah, if this is what you want, letÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s get it on.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ We wanted something and THC gave us Ã¢â‚¬ËœPeacemaker.Ã¢â‚¬â„¢ ThatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s good enough for us.Heavy
